["Gathios the Shatterer:-1"] = {
["MeleePercent"] = 101.5948107769565,
["TargetDamage"] = 11759165,
["RangedHits"] = 0,
["MeleeHits"] = 147,
["LastLevel"] = 70,
["RangedPercent"] = 0,
["TargetPoints"] = 970,

The lua from the mod says:
--FIRST STEP: CALCULATE ARMOR
local pr = 0;
if ( TotalMeleeHits > TotalRangedHits ) then
pr = 1 - ( TotalMeleePercentage ) / ( TotalMeleeHits );
else
pr = 1 - ( TotalRangedPercentage ) / ( TotalRangedHits );
end

local ea = TargetArmor_PercentToArmor(pr, PlayerLevel);

pr = floor(pr*10000+.5)/100;
ea = floor(ea+.5);
Credit to Rava
#731SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3◊ vank
Thank you so much, Cheeky... again.
#732SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3
Edited onPatch 2.1.3		QuiggyB
The numbers the sheet is calculating for the +1 attributes seem quite a bit different than what I got with the previous sheet making a custom offhand, putting 1 in each ability slot and comparing the change in personal and total dps. Here is an example for a SV build and a BM build with the same gear. For each build the first line is personal dps, the second line is total dps. I did put -50 hit on the custom offhand to get myslef under the hit cap but I checked it with 0 and it did not substantially change the values (other than hit). To be clear, thats the values version 28 gave vs the values 29 is auto-computing. I didnt have time to do the same test on version 29. FWIW I did have a dragonspine equipped so its possible the haste change is throwing the numbers.

Last edited by QuiggyB : 09/15/07 at 4:42 AM.
#733SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by QuiggyB
The numbers the sheet is calculating for the +1 attributes seem quite a bit different than what I got with the previous sheet making a custom offhand, putting 1 in each ability slot and comparing the change in personal and total dps. Here is an example for a SV build and a BM build with the same gear. For each build the first line is personal dps, the second line is total dps. I did put -50 hit on the custom offhand to get myslef under the hit cap but I checked it with 0 and it did not substantially change the values (other than hit). To be clear, thats the values version 28 gave vs the values 29 is auto-computing. I didnt have time to do the same test on version 29. FWIW I did have a dragonspine equipped so its possible the haste change is throwing the numbers.
The [Dragonspine Trophy] is going to make difference, I'm just not sure how much of one. When I do this same test for my gear I get numbers that are exact for AP, and 0.01 off (probably rounding/display error) for Crit and Agility. Also, try re-generating the "+1" numbers after putting the -50 hit, but before adding in the other stats, to give yourself an accurate baseline.
#734SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3QuiggyB
Found something else. It seems when blessing of kings is selected AND rank 2 (67agi) or rank 3 (77agi) GoA is selected the values computed for agility are roughly 2x what they should be. If you set GoA to no and put 67 or 77agi under a custom offhand you get the same result. If you modify the number by 1 up or down the value for agi drops in half again.

e.g. BOK & 77agi custom offhand = 1.06dps per agility. BOK % 78agi = 0.53dps per agility.

I got these results with a 41/20BM build and a 21/40 SV build. I did not get this result with a 5/47/9 MM build. For the BM and SV builds I had 5/5 lethal, 5/5 Eff, 2/2 GFTT, 2/2 rapid, aimed, and 5/5 Mortal. for the MM build I had 5/5 IAotH, the marks tree filled up including 5/5 Imp Arcane, and 9 points in the bottom tier of the surv tree.

I just tried it looking more at the MM talents. I get this 2x result until I put points in combat experience at which point it goes away. I also reset all talents to zero, got the 2X issue, put two points in combat experience and it went away. for whatever reason if I start with a SV or BM build though putting points in CE does not make the issue go away. In all cases having an agi value other than 67 or 77 in combination with BOK does make it go away.
#735SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3Cranch
Nice job on the CalcAttributes button! I just use the hand-adjust section, so never thought to make the suggestion.

I would suggest you add int, haste rating, and armor penetration as well, as they also affect dps (that's what I use in my item rating spreadsheet.)

I heard a rumor that the Blizzard developers are using your spreadsheet to analyze hunter dps. Maybe you can check if the computer running the spreadsheet is in the blizzard domain and silently degrade dps by 15%...

Could you provide more information? Specifically:

1 - What application are you using?
2 - Are you talking about the "+1" valuations? Realize they do no automatically re-generate values unless you change gear. Otherwise you have to click the "CalcAttributes" button on the 'Gear' tab.

Testing this with my gear and build, everything looks normal, same with swapping around to a MM build:
Base: Agi +0.74, AP +0.37, Cirt +0.66, +Hit 0.00
Kings: Agi +0.74, AP +0.38, Cirt +0.66, +Hit 0.00
Kings + GoA (2): Agi +0.75, AP +0.38, Cirt +0.66, +Hit 0.00
Kings + GoA (3): Agi +0.75, AP +0.38, Cirt +0.66, +Hit 0.00
GoA(3): Agi +0.74, AP +0.38, Cirt +0.66, +Hit 0.00

If you would like to email me a copy of the spreadsheet with all your values filled in, contact me via pm for an email address.

Hunter DPS Spreadsheet - Test



In the sheet linked above, I have no talents defined. I have my gear under the gear tab. I have BOK, GOA, LotP, Gift, and Elixir of Greater Agility selected. Dropping LotP does not change the result. Dropping any of the +agility buffs, setting the agility for a custom offhand to +1 or -1, or putting points in combat experience changes the first set of results to the second set of results. I am clicking the calculate button on the gear tab each time.

#743SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by QuiggyB
Im using Excel 2003 SP2 from Office 2003 Professional on Windows XP

Hunter DPS Spreadsheet - Test



In the sheet linked above, I have no talents defined. I have my gear under the gear tab. I have BOK, GOA, LotP, Gift, and Elixir of Greater Agility selected. Dropping LotP does not change the result. Dropping any of the +agility buffs, setting the agility for a custom offhand to +1 or -1, or putting points in combat experience changes the first set of results to the second set of results. I am clicking the calculate button on the gear tab each time.
I figured it out, I believe. I use a Floor() function on the final attributes of the 'Gear' tab. This is adding some problems, because with everything you set up the first point of Agility added translates to +2 Agility after Kings and Lightning Reflexes, but the second point of agility translates to +3. It adds a stair-step look to the data that shouldn't be there.

In the next version I will remove the floor() function, but change display settings to not show decimal values, even though I'll carry them through the rest of the equations.

Cool problem to find. Maybe I should change the macro to add +10 of each, and then divide the difference by 10? This would suck for hit rating, but I can do it for the others.
#744SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3QuiggyB
If it was the floor function, why would adding in 1 point on the custom page make it go away? Seems like all the other agility points should have still been scaled wrong. You can also turn off GoA completely and the problem will go away. If you then put exactly 67 or 77 in the custom weapon property for agility it will reappear. Any other value will not cause. Since those two values are the same values rank 2 and 3 GoA provide, I assumed it was some bug in the buff calcs that were looking for those two values specifically.
#745SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by QuiggyB
If it was the floor function, why would adding in 1 point on the custom page make it go away? Seems like all the other agility points should have still been scaled wrong. You can also turn off GoA completely and the problem will go away. If you then put exactly 67 or 77 in the custom weapon property for agility it will reappear. Any other value will not cause. Since those two values are the same values rank 2 and 3 GoA provide, I assumed it was some bug in the buff calcs that were looking for those two values specifically.
There are going to be times (because of the floor function) where +1 Agility is seen as +2 through multiplicative buffs and times when it is seen as just +1. This is exactly what you were seeing in the version you hosted. Those times it translates into +2 are going to provide double the DPS gain as when it is +1.

The fix is to carry more specific digits of data through all of the calculations. I'm doing that in the beta version and it seems to address the problem, as well as be more accurate overall.
#746SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3• Keltan
Originally Posted by Cheeky
Cool problem to find. Maybe I should change the macro to add +10 of each, and then divide the difference by 10? This would suck for hit rating, but I can do it for the others.
This is exactly what I was doing by hand prior to ver. 29. Seemed to really help smooth out the value of each stat and minimize the times Lightning Reflexes/Master Marksman/Survival Instincts will be at a point that +1 Agility/AP is enough to change a rounding down to a rounding up and report a value that is more inline with a +2 stat increase, instead of just +1.
#747SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3
Edited onPatch 2.1.3		QuiggyB
Makes perfect sense, thanks =) For things like hit where +10 could waste points by going over the cap, would it work to just subtract 10 and compare the smaller value against the current value. It would be the same as saying your last point of the stat got you this much dps instead of saying gaining a point would increase it by this much. I think the actual numbers would be the same. Can also just add dps to the end of the x axis on the attribute matrix rather than having two windows. i.e. an agi is worth x ap, crit, hit, int, armor pen, dps.
Last edited by QuiggyB : 09/15/07 at 8:39 PM.

#776SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3Fuulish

#777SourcePosted on Patch 2.1.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Fuulish
Oh I didn't realize you could already name the sets. Sorry about that. Could you tell me how?
On the 'Settings and Results' tab, just click on the set name and change it to whatever you want. Next time you select the drop down menu on the 'Gear' tabs it will have your names.

I think the whole feature breaks if you use the same name twice, so try and keep them different.

#787SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0MikeMo
I know crit is typically lower since by defaul the spread sheet calculates it based on the fact that you will be fighting a level 73 boss. I am not sure why your AP is lower however.
#788SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0Bikiniwax
Originally Posted by MikeMo
I know crit is typically lower since by defaul the spread sheet calculates it based on the fact that you will be fighting a level 73 boss. I am not sure why your AP is lower however.
You're right! I had it set to a lvl 73 mob. Once I set it to lvl 70, my Crit jumped to 27.22% which matches my armoury. Thanks!

Unfortunately, my RAP still reports 1848 on the spreadsheet but 1816 on my Armory.


EDIT: Nevermind! I figured it out. I was looking at Total, Effective RAP which includes Procs (DST). Above that, my RAP shows 1816. Stupid brain.

Thanks again!

#794SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0
Edited onPatch 2.2.0		Xeno
version 30 bug: There's a problem with the relentless earthstorm diamond in that if you don't have the correct gems it will remain active for the purposes of increased critical hit damage.

RED also doesn't increase the total critical hit damage for arcane shot like other shots. If you have mortal shots the critical hit damage will be 233% unlike the other shots which would be 236.9%

Mark of conquest seems to be listed as 42.8 mp5? I'm sure this is just a typo, it's closer to 32 mp5, definitely between 30-35.

Choker of Serated Blades is incorrectly listed as having 154 armor penetration when in fact it is 175.

On a different note, would it be possible to make public the calculations for attributes + 1? Specifically haste, it seems … incorrect.

edit: Calculations!D32 has a typo Ranged WeaponWeapon DPS

edit: After looking at the mark of conquest calculation it seems like the problem is that you have it as a flat chance on hit. From my testing the internal cooldown is 17 secs (very confident of that number) with a 13% chance to proc (reasonably confident of that number.)

edit: The problem with the +1 haste attribute was that I had just passed the quick shots "haste cap" effectively halving the +1 haste value.
Last edited by Xeno : 09/27/07 at 6:29 AM.
#795SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0◊ Lactose
Originally Posted by Xeno
On a different note, would it be possible to make public the calculations for attributes + 1? Specifically haste, it seems … incorrect.
The +1 part is a macro that increases the amount of the stat by 1, then runs the calculations again, storing the values and compares them at the end.

Adding the other points to the bug list. I'm sure there'll be incorrect items and such, even after the next version. If so, just post or PM me.
#796SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0xEw
Originally Posted by Xeno
Mark of conquest seems to be listed as 42.8 mp5? I'm sure this is just a typo, it's closer to 32 mp5, definitely between 30-35.
There is no "definitely" because it's a hitproc and therefore it's dependant on your attackspeed/shotfrequency. Theoretically there are quite higher effective mp5-values possible than 42,8.

#799SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0Cheeky
Version 31
The 2.2 version (31) is now released. I'll get the OO version up later today. I have not changed the [Mark of Conquest] model yet, but based on new information I plan to.

Change Log:
- Corrected a bug in figuring out miss rates for weapon skill 351-354. Everything else was spot on.
- Resorted list of Chest items. This was causing some items to appear with the wrong statistics.
- Added new gear ([Messenger of Fate], [Shadowvine Cloak of Infusion], [Embrace of the Dawn], [Blazing Eternium Band], [Deathwing Brood Cloak] of the Bandit, [Stylin' Crimson Hat], [Delicate Fire Ruby], [Rigid Bladestone], [Stone of Blades], [Crimson Sun], [Falling Star], [Claw of the Phoenix]).
- Fixed description of [Balanced Shadowsong Amethyst]
- Updated items ([Fel Edged Battleaxe], [Figurine - Talasite Owl], [Timelapse Shard], [Warmth of Forgiveness], [Merciless Gladiator's Painsaw], [Choker of Serrated Blades], [Arcanite Steam-Pistol], [Serpent Spine Longbow], [Fang of Vashj], [Talon of Azshara], [Talon of the Phoenix], [Netherbane], [Twinblade of the Phoenix])
- Removed items ([item]Infused Shadow Draenite).
- Added new enchants (Greater Agility to weapons).
- Fixed a bug where the [Relentless Earthstorm Diamond] would grantbonus crit damage even if you didn't have the gem requirements met.
- The [Relentless Earthstorm Diamond] no longer adds critical strike damage to Arcane Shot.
- Only 2.2 Haste Rating conversions are used.
- Removed Sharpening Stones from weapon buffs.

#812SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0
Edited onPatch 2.2.0		liquidf
Suggested changes to spreadsheet
Hi Cheeky, great work on the spreadsheets. I have a couple of suggestions:

You can easily use your model to create a really powerful gear searching tool tailored to the hunter. The basic concept is to work out the personalised relative value of each stat, and then create automated (for example) allakhazam search links from that; or just ordering the gear by relative value.

There are a few relatively easy (but kind of major) tweaks you need to make to allow this to happen.
- Create a simple macro that creates an array with the relative merit in terms of both DPS and "time till oom" for every stat. You do this by setting the base dps and time till oom, then increasing each stat by 1 in sequence and recording the impact on dps/time till oom. This is actually much easier than it sounds.
- from here, you have scores for each stat and can create weighted allakhazam searches (eg my personalised base search for dps armor would be this link which i automatically generated knowing agi is worth 0.6, AP 0.31 etc etc (with some assumptions about the best gems, and for me excluding raid drops due to current time zone constraints on my raiding). You can then make simple changes in allakhazam to sort by slot etc. The search for weapons is slightly different.
- you can then create a column on each of the gear sheets that has the same weighting, and use this to sort gear in terms of merit rather than alphabetical order. You could also include perhaps a "score" for the gear selected on the gear spreadsheet including both the dps score and "time till oom" score to make the new selection simpler.
- to allow this sorting to happen you have to use "vlookup" rather than "lookup". Lookup is quite limited in that your lists have to be alphabetical to find the linked value. vlookup just looks for matches - so your list can be sorted in any way. Basically this involves changing every lookup on the gear sheet - which sounds major, but only takes an hour or so with some smart search/replacing.

Like I said I've kind of had a dodgy go at this. If you want to see what I've done I can email my crappy version of the spreadsheet file to you. I have to admit and apologise up front that I've done a dodgy crack of your spreadsheet to make these changes myself - excel security sucks :/.
Last edited by liquidf : 09/28/07 at 2:09 AM. Reason: grammar
#813SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0Xeno
Did some proc chance testing on dr boom today, just autoshotting with a final speed of 1.92. No misses. Internal cooldown assumed to be 17 secs. Serpents swiftness, 15% quiver, 2.7 speed weapon, 1.71% passive haste.
Autoshots: 7843
Procs: 527
Total time: 7843*1.92=15058.86s
Time spend inside the internal cooldown: 527*17=8959s
Remaining time outside the internal cooldown: 15058.86-8959=6099.56s
Hits outside the internal cooldown: 6099.56/1.92=3176.854
Proc chance outside the internal cooldown: 527/3176.854=.165887

#818SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.0
Edited onPatch 2.2.0		Marthel
With respect to the macros in Mac OSX, the problem with the buttons is that they are implemented using activeX controls, which are not available on the mac. It is possible to use a different type of button which works on both Mac and PC using the forms toolbar (so I understand). It would probably be a lot of work changing it over (and since I can't run the macros manually there are probably more problems than just the buttons). Anyway whilst some of the convenience of the spreadsheet isnt available to max excel users its still a fabulous tool.
Last edited by Marthel : 09/30/07 at 2:23 AM.

#822SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2intressepil
If my question has been answered earlier in the thread, slap me, but here goes:

How does your spreadsheet calculate the hit cap? I was under the impression that a hunter's base hit cap against a boss is 9% (taken from the sticky in this forum) and according to Lacoste's info one point of weapon skill (not rating) gives 0.24% hit. That'd put a dwarf with a gun (or a troll with a bow, I suppose) at a cap of 7.8% or 123 hit rating. I have exactly 123 hit rating equipped and a gun, but yet when I unequip hit rating in your spreadsheet it still reports a 100% hit chance. According to your spreadsheet, the hit cap with specialization taken into account seems to be at 91 or 92 hit rating (and yes, I have set the mob lvl to 73 in the settings). What have I missed? Thanks in advance.

#826SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2• Tsook
Cheeky/Lactose-

My tests indicate that in 2.2 RED still applies to arcane shot, but as a special case. It's additive instead of multiplicative for arcane shot while remaining multiplicative for all other attacks.

http://elitistjerks.com/487245-post115.html

Nakari also tested this on ptr before 2.2 and his (her?) results agree: http://elitistjerks.com/482604-post101.html

#829SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2Zurai
On at least the Open Office version, Twinblade of the Phoenix is bugged; it uses the stats for the Twin-Bladed Ripper instead.
#830SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2Cheeky
Originally Posted by Zurai
On at least the Open Office version, Twinblade of the Phoenix is bugged; it uses the stats for the Twin-Bladed Ripper instead.
That is due to an alphabitizing mistake. I have changed the way lookups work to prevent these from happening in the future.

#834SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2◊ Lactose
OpenOffice is free, but does not support macros.
There is supposedly a OpenOffice version from Novell that does support macros, but it requires some sort of registration.

This is most easily seen by setting the shot rotation to auto only, then changing the latency value. I believe I back-tracked it to the WeightShotsPerSecond value from the DST calculations, but got a little overwhelmed there =)

For reference, I'm using a 41/20 build, with an Hourglass & Bloodlust Brooch as trinkets, if that figures in.
#836SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2Cheeky
Originally Posted by Fendryl
I noticed there seems to be a slight problem with the latency figure. It seems to apply against autoshots? This is most easily seen by setting the shot rotation to auto only, then changing the latency value. I believe I back-tracked it to the WeightShotsPerSecond value from the DST calculations, but got a little overwhelmed there =)

For reference, I'm using a 41/20 build, with an Hourglass & Bloodlust Brooch as trinkets, if that figures in.
I apply latency to everything. Not sure if it matters on Auto Shot unless you macro-spam, but you'd have to be running a pretty high latency figure to see it on just Auto Shots. I'll think about it some more though.
#837SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2Cheeky
Version 31
Version 31 (both regular and OO) is available.

I did not yet incorporate all the bugs found here, there were a few infrastructure changes I focused on. There is also a set of basic instructions which should get posted to the top of the thread soon.

Change Log:
- Corrected item stats ([Band of the Eternal Champion], [Fel Edged Battleaxe], [Grand Marshal's Chain Gauntlets])
- Converted gear matrix to use VLOOKUP instead of LOOKUP. This will allow for more features to be added later.
- Gear sets now save race, talent spec, shot rotations (all 4), and Pet details.
- Added ability to Export and Import all 5 profiles. This only loads them into the database, to see the information you need to Load the specific profile back on the Gear tab. The file CheekyHunterDPS.log is created/read in the My Documents directory.
- Corrected bug in calculating shot numbers for DST rotations.
- Renamed Shot Rotation buttons to better correspond with common naming.
- Changed MaxSpecials rotation to build 1:1.X rotations based on whether or not the user wishes to include Multi or Arcane Shots.
- Changed PriorityRotation to not allow clipping, but only sub in Arcane and/or Multi when the next Steady Shot will not clip because of GCD.
- Provide a 1:1.X rotation button for Quick Shots.
- Updated Scorpid Poison rank 5 to be 55 damage over 10 seconds.
- Changed the Spell Coefficient for Scorpid poison to be 0.1
- Moved custom target information in 'Settings and Results' tab. Display effective reduction values for both Hunter and Pet.
#838SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.2◊ Lactose
Main posts fully updated. Now includes a guide to using the spreadsheet.

- Corrected Item Stats (Spiteblade).

#852SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3intressepil
This is all very minor and all, but I'm curious. Last night I finally got my [Darkmoon Card: Crusade] and I'm a happy tosser. One weird thing that I noticed though, was that I got got two different buffs from it; one larger expected stack of extra ap, and sometimes a smaller stack of exta spelldmg would start building. It didn't take long for me to realize that it was Kill Command which initiated that spelldmg-stack. I guess this means that Kill Command does spelldamage. As this is pretty minor, I can realize if Cheeky simply says "no, this is to minor for a fix", I'm curious if this is taken into account while modeling the Crusade card in the spreadsheet ("this" being the fact that Kill Command would deal more damage if you have the card, especially in a longer fight where the pet is just hitting the boss, like Void Reaver or Morogrim).
#853SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3◊ Lactose
Kill Command may be classified as a spell (which I think it is), but it does not do spell damage. I'm pretty sure it does normal (physical) damage, unaltered by +Spell Damage gear.
#854SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Shandara
The same way wands are a physical attack that deals magical damage (and the card stacks up +AP for wands..). And wands aren't affected by AP of course.

Not very logical, but probably a limitation of the mechanic used by the card.
#855SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3intressepil
I see, thanks for the quick replies.

I'm not questioning the math. I'm more at a loss as to how this could be. I'm scouring these forums 20 times a day, and it's always been my impression that this trinket is a clear cut upgrade, regardless of spec, even after the nerf.

What am I missing?
#857SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by vank
Was wondering if anyone else noticed that Dragonspine Trophy is lowering their DPS on the spreadsheet as a Survival spec. I'm modeling with both Sunfury and Steam Pistol, 1:1.5 rotation, 0/20/41 build.

I'm not questioning the math. I'm more at a loss as to how this could be. I'm scouring these forums 20 times a day, and it's always been my impression that this trinket is a clear cut upgrade, regardless of spec, even after the nerf.

What am I missing?
Is the Shot Rotation you use with the DST active lower DPS than your normal one? If so, then any DST procs will lower your DPS.

Always question the math if it doesn't seem right. Otherwise people wouldn't catch all my fuck-ups.
#858SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3◊ vank
I just re-specced survival last night and have not killed a single mob. I'm basing all of this on The Spreadsheet. As that goes, I would assume 1:1 rotation when hasted. Auto -> Steady, unhasted, is definitely less DPS than Auto->Steady->Special->Auto->Steady; so I think the answer to your question is "yes", which makes me a sad man.
#859SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Gruknok

Auto -> Steady, unhasted, is definitely less DPS than Auto->Steady->Special->Auto->Steady; so I think the answer to your question is "yes", which makes me a sad man.
Dont forget mana pool. But id say you need to screw up your gear so much to be low on mana as survival.
#860SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by vank
I just re-specced survival last night and have not killed a single mob. I'm basing all of this on The Spreadsheet. As that goes, I would assume 1:1 rotation when hasted. Auto -> Steady, unhasted, is definitely less DPS than Auto->Steady->Special->Auto->Steady; so I think the answer to your question is "yes", which makes me a sad man.
I did an analysis on the official forums on the 2.2 DST and it really doesn't help MM/Survival Hunters anymore from a DPS standpoint. You don't get enough of a haste effect with the 2.9s-3.0s weapons to out DPS the 1:1.5 rotation unhasted. It's a good way to recover a ton of mana efficiency at the cost of some DPS, but it won't increase your damage done.

For BM Hunters the haste proc isn't up enough with the internal cooldown to make up for the DPS lost staying in a 1:1 rotation unhasted with slow weapons.

Whatever the intent to control Rogue DPS was, the changes to haste/DST pretty much wrecked it for Hunters. For really high DPS slow weapons it is nice (BM Hunters only), but it's not a whole lot better than other trinkets.
#861SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Krytos
Lag
I ping anywhere from 200-300 to my server.

I play survival spec with 1:1.5 rotation.
I noticed a 80dps loss when going from 100ms lag to 300ms lag in the spreadsheet. The reason for this is that autoshot is delayed by about .3 seconds every step of the way in my rotation.

Since fixing the lag isn't really a reliable option, I was wondering if a stop casting macro would be viable like the mages use.

has anyone messed around with different ways to eliminate down time in the rotation in such a way?

Like i said, eliminating the lag from a rotation, could yeild 80-100 dps difference for a 1:1.5 rotation that is so dependant on lag time.

02:44'28.312 Krytos's Auto Shot crits High Astromancer Solarian for 1497

02:44'55.453 Krytos's Auto Shot hits High Astromancer Solarian for 797
you can see where i let 2 auto shots go off without casting any other spells. the delay was 2.56 which is VERY close to the 2.52 target time.

as soon as the rotation starts, most are 2.8-2.9 some worse some better.

I have a macro for steady auto, the same one that everyone uses, while steady is going im spamming my arcane shot.

the rotation i use with 0 lag, should not interrupt auto shot. but we can see here in the log that its being delayed by almost half a second every time. I attribute this to the 300ms lag I normally get to my wow server.

edit: this leads me to believe that autoshot dps might not be much affected by lag on its own, but cast lag and gcd lag have a major affect.
Last edited by Krytos : 10/09/07 at 5:16 PM.
#864SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Krytos
the rotation i use with 0 lag, should not interrupt auto shot. but we can see here in the log that its being delayed by almost half a second every time. I attribute this to the 300ms lag I normally get to my wow server.

edit: this leads me to believe that autoshot dps might not be much affected by lag on its own, but cast lag and gcd lag have a major affect.
Any macro gets punished by lag. There is also a fair bit of jitter in combat logs.

The log you link has a bunch of long delays between shots, so it's not real useful to draw conclusions from. Getting a similar log from a stand-still fight like Dr. Boom is a better way to generalize. You have periods with 4-5 seconds between Auto Shots, I'm assuming this is from movement, bandaging, etc.
#865SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3sepulturian
Hey,
I'm really new to this sort of thing and have been taking awhile to explore the spreadsheet. Its absoluetly brilliant...I didn't even think that something like this was possible. I was looking for something like this for aaages. Now forgive me, but I've added all my gear and all and can't seem to find a cell that displays my total ranged attack power, and also the buttons in the spreadsheet don't work (save/load etc) when i click em. Anyone know why?
#866SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by sepulturian
Hey,
I'm really new to this sort of thing and have been taking awhile to explore the spreadsheet. Its absoluetly brilliant...I didn't even think that something like this was possible. I was looking for something like this for aaages. Now forgive me, but I've added all my gear and all and can't seem to find a cell that displays my total ranged attack power, and also the buttons in the spreadsheet don't work (save/load etc) when i click em. Anyone know why?
You can find your RAP in the 'Calculations' tab. Good idea on moving that to the 'Settings and Results' though, I'll try and get that done in the next version.

If the buttons don't work it's usually 1 of 2 problems:

1 - You are not using Microsoft Excel, but Open Office. Open Office does not support Visual Basic, which is what the buttons use.

2 - You are using Microsoft Excel, but you have the security settings set to not use macros. The buttons are macros, and in general macros could do potentially bad things to your computer. Mine do not (and it's one of the reasons I password protect the whole thing.) You can enable macros for the spreadhseet and the buttons should do what they are supposed to.

And thank you for the kind words.
#867SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Mandaboo
Another possibility is that you haven't selected/changed the set name. I have been using Cheeky's spreadsheet for awhile now and thought I had learned all the little tricks of it, but then felt really dumb when I realized that there is this handy little set feature. When you click the buttons, it saves the set to whatever the set name currently is in cell B6 on the Gear Tab. You can use the drop down box to select a different set to save or load in that cell. You can change the name of the sets in cell H27-H31 on the Settings and Results tab. You are possibly smarter than I apparently am and figured this out already, but just offering it as a possible simple solution to your problem

The other new 2.2 patterns are: [Design: Great Golden Draenite], [Design: Balanced Shadow Draenite], [Design: Veiled Flame Spessarite], [Design: Wicked Flame Spessarite]. Apparently these also drop from BEM summoned mobs & dragons.

#892SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Zomghuntar
In version 34 armor from agility isn't being added in to total armor on the gear tab.
I'm seeing this work correctly. You can check in cells B66-B68 on the 'Calculations' tab to verify.

Originally Posted by Exhaler
Will the new Items from patch 2.3 and Zulaman be added now, or will you wait until the realease of all content.

Cause pretty much all loot is already announced on wowhead
Generally I hold off until things have settled down, but based on the feedback I'm getting regards previously unknown bugs in the 'Custom Gear' tab people really want this soon. I'll try and get it all in for a new version this weekend. As you find things I've missed, just post them here (using Item Links saves me time.)
#893SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Zomghuntar
Originally Posted by Cheeky
I'm seeing this work correctly. You can check in cells B66-B68 on the 'Calculations' tab to verify.
On the Calculations tab it does show me getting the 1707 armor from agility, but on the Gear tab the cell is =SUM(C87:C90)*(1+C91)*(1+C92) Which gives my base armor of 5233 because it isn't adding in the armor from agility on the Calculations tab.
#894SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Zomghuntar
On the Calculations tab it does show me getting the 1707 armor from agility, but on the Gear tab the cell is =SUM(C87:C90)*(1+C91)*(1+C92) Which gives my base armor of 5233 because it isn't adding in the armor from agility on the Calculations tab.
Ok, that cell is only the total from your gear and buffs. If you look at the top of the 'Gear' tab (or on the 'Settings and Results' tab) that total includes everything.
#895SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Zomghuntar
Originally Posted by Cheeky
Ok, that cell is only the total from your gear and buffs. If you look at the top of the 'Gear' tab (or on the 'Settings and Results' tab) that total includes everything.
Lol, I should probably refrain from looking at the spreadsheet while I'm in my 7am class and wait until I'm awake. :-) Thanks for the clarification.

#900SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Dhirken

#901SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Belzi.ET
Originally Posted by Sumpfmolch
in the spreadsheet shot rotation:
steady casttime with quiver is 1,3s but the next shot starts after 1,5s because of gcd = 1,5s

wowwiki states:
Global Cooldown is refreshed when the spell ends, for spells with a casting time less than 1.5 seconds, and greater than 0.5 seconds.

shouldn't the next shot start at 1,3s instead of 1,5s ?
With a 1:1 auto-steady rotation, the next steady shot should come after 1.8s (1.3s steady-casttime an 0.5s for the internal auto-casttime) or later (depends on weapon speed).


A little off topic, but still about Hunters:
When I think about it. Is it possible, that this internal auto-casttime is affected by quiver and/or serpents swiftness (or even by IAotH)?
Have there been any tests about?
#902SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3• Glaurong
Originally Posted by Belzi.ET
With a 1:1 auto-steady rotation, the next steady shot should come after 1.8s (1.3s steady-casttime an 0.5s for the internal auto-casttime) or later (depends on weapon speed).


A little off topic, but still about Hunters:
When I think about it. Is it possible, that this internal auto-casttime is affected by quiver and/or serpents swiftness (or even by IAotH)?
Have there been any tests about?
With the amount of jitter introduced into the combat log by latency it is pretty much impossible to determine. We still don't have an exact number for the hidden auto shot cast but a half second has worked as a good estimate for a while.

#910SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Version 35
This version incorporates a few new big features. I have less faith in this being bug-free than any recent version, so don't delete your current version just yet. I'm going to need a lot of feedback to get the new Armory stuff just right.

If it works out, I'll add scraping talents specs as well. And expanding it to EU Armories. There is little error handling done yet, so if you specify invalid character names or realms all bets are off.

No new Open Office version yet. I anticipate a bunch of quick fixes this week.

Change Log:
- Added Sunder Armor and Faerie Fire to target debuff list.
- Cleaned up some validation lists to remove spaces. This was causing Open Office to fail a bunch of string comparisons.
- Updated the VLOOKUPs in the Gear page. This should remove any issues with alphabetizing the gear sets. (So yes, I was an idiot when I did it the first time.)
- Corrected math behind the effects of special pet attacks on frenzy uptime. This will result in a lower % time spent in Frenzy than previous versions.
- Fixed problem where Custom Bracers were not using the supplied values for Resilience and Armor Penetration.
- Corrected the description of the Unstable Citrine to be correct (8 AP, 4 Crit).
- Corrected a bug in the Pet Special Attacks table that resulted in negative rates of use for low focus regeneration.
- Fixed all issues with Resilience, Haste, and Armor Penetration on Custom Gear.
- Added new gear from 2.3 PTR.
- Consolidated all Arena gear set names to "Gladiator's Pursuit".
- Removed Weapon skill.
- Added in Troll/Dwarf racials
- Provide for a drop down choice of different raid Bosses to get armor values. These values have no been verified, and anything with a value of "9999" is still unknown. Custom target (armor supplied by user) is still available. These can be selected by choosing your Target on the 'Settings and Results' tab. I would like to thank Lactose of Talinvarr (EU) and Dayve of Gorgonnash for providing the values so far.
- Corrected some spelling mistakes in item names.
- Added ability to load gear from Armory for a character. This is still in initial development, and will probably be very buggy for a while. Each item/gem is validated. Sometimes there are spelling mistakes in this spreadsheet and the item will not be loaded properly. Please contact Cheeky with those mistakes and I will correct them as soon as I can. Item enchants are not currently supported. These still need to be updated manually. I would like to thank Mikla of Burning Legion for providing me examples and modules to make this feature possible.
#911SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Osse

#912SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Fendryl

- Added ability to load gear from Armory for a character. This is still in initial development, and will probably be very buggy for a while. Each item/gem is validated. Sometimes there are spelling mistakes in this spreadsheet and the item will not be loaded properly. Please contact Cheeky with those mistakes and I will correct them as soon as I can. Item enchants are not currently supported. These still need to be updated manually. I would like to thank Mikla of Burning Legion for providing me examples and modules to make this feature possible.

Beast-tamer's Shoulders generates an armory import error, as does the Band of Eternity. I'm not sure of a good solution for the rep rings, unless there's a way you can map from stats to the spreadsheet's db.

Also I noticed loading my v34 profile had a problem with an infused nightseye that's in my belt; reselecting the gem from the drop down fixed it though.

Originally Posted by Fendryl
Wow, that's impressive & amazingly handy.

Beast-tamer's Shoulders generates an armory import error, as does the Band of Eternity. I'm not sure of a good solution for the rep rings, unless there's a way you can map from stats to the spreadsheet's db.

Also I noticed loading my v34 profile had a problem with an infused nightseye that's in my belt; reselecting the gem from the drop down fixed it though.
The rep rings are going to be a royal pain in the ass. I'll see about how hard it is to compare stats. They may just have to be a special case.

In all cases, drop down menus should work fine. The enchants not working is a limitation to my understanding of Armory's interfaces. I can get a number for the enchant, but no way to turn that into a name. (The idea of my researching the mapping myself is a non-starter, I don't have the time. If someone else wants to do it, I can map from those numbers to the enchant's name.)


I'm using all of you as my test team on this one. There are just too many things that need testing for me to do it myself. Keep the information coming. I'm provide updates every couple of days, I think. If you find spelling problems, please use the item tags feature in your response, so we guarantee the proper spelling.

#929SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3
Edited onPatch 2.3.0		♦ Tsook
Off the top of my head, other target debuffs that affect hunter dps
  • Blood Frenzy: +2/4% physical damage (from MS warriors; pretty much 100% uptime)
  • Improved Faerie Fire: +1/2/3% hit (from balance druids; most significant for pets since the hunter is likely hit capped without it)
  • Improved Judgment of the Crusader: +1/2/3% crit (from ret paladins)
  • Judgment of Wisdom: 50% chance on hit of +74 mana (any paladin)
  • Judgment of Light: 50% chance on melee to heal 90 (since you don't model anything about pet health currently, probably can drop that one)
  • Misery: +1/2/3/4/5% magic damage (from spriests; pretty much 100% uptime; affects arcane shot, serpent sting, lightning breath, serpent and scorpid poison)
  • Stormstrike: +20% nature damage (from enh shaman; fairly low uptime; affects serpent sting, lightning breath, serpent and scorpid poison [dots don't consume the effect but do benefit from it if it's up during a tick])

As far as buffs, there's also
  • Improved Sanctity Aura: +1/2% damage (from ret paladin)
  • Unleashed Rage: +2/4/6/8/10% melee ap (from Enh shaman; uptime is good but not 100% so I don't know how you'd model that without it being ridiculous)
  • Improved Divine Spirit: +5/10% of spirit as +dam (from disc priests; used to like this for Scorpid Poison hax, but otherwise is just a minor buff to wind serpent damage)
  • Totem of Wrath: +3% spell hit and crit (from ele shaman; also a buff to wind serpent damage and FI uptime)
  • Wrath of Air Totem: +101 spell damage (any shaman; for wind serpents)
  • Moonkin Aura: +5% spell crit (from balance druids; wind serpent damage and FI uptime)
Last edited by Tsook : 12/13/07 at 10:14 PM.

#944SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3♦ Glaurong
After a bit of reverse engineering all you need is the following:

http://www.wowarmory.com/item-tooltip.xml?i=<item id>&r=<realm>&n=<character name>

That will return you the information the armory uses for the tooltip.

This query: http://www.wowarmory.com/item-toolti...r=Hyjal&n=Glau

Returns the following:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/layout/item-tooltip.xsl"?>

<page globalSearch="1" lang="en_us" requestUrl="/item-tooltip.xml">
  <itemTooltips>
    <itemTooltip>
      <id>30892</id>
      <name>Beast-tamer's Shoulders</name>
      <icon>inv_shoulder_59</icon>

      <overallQualityId>4</overallQualityId>
      <bonding>1</bonding>
      <classId>4</classId>
      <equipData>
        <inventoryType>3</inventoryType>
        <subclassName>Mail</subclassName>

      </equipData>
      <damageData/>
      <bonusAgility>39</bonusAgility>
      <bonusStamina>38</bonusStamina>
      <armor armorBonus="0">741</armor>
      <enchant>+26 Attack Power</enchant>
      <durability current="85" max="85"/>

      <requiredLevel>70</requiredLevel>
      <spellData>
        <spell>
          <trigger>1</trigger>
          <desc>Increases attack power by 78.</desc>
        </spell>
        <spell>

          <trigger>1</trigger>
          <desc>Increases damage dealt by your pet by 3%.</desc>
        </spell>
        <spell>
          <trigger>1</trigger>
          <desc>Increases your pet's critical strike chance by 2%.</desc>
        </spell>

      </spellData>
      <itemSource areaId="3606" areaName="Hyjal Summit" creatureId="17888" creatureName="Kaz'rogal" difficulty="n" dropRate="3" value="sourceType.creatureDrop"/>
    </itemTooltip>
  </itemTooltips>
</page>
Enjoy =)

Edit: Sorry, I should have included an example with socket data too:

http://www.wowarmory.com/item-toolti...r=Hyjal&n=Glau

Returns:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/layout/item-tooltip.xsl"?>

<page globalSearch="1" lang="en_us" requestUrl="/item-tooltip.xml">
  <itemTooltips>
    <itemTooltip>
      <id>29515</id>
      <name>Ebon Netherscale Breastplate</name>
      <icon>inv_chest_plate08</icon>

      <overallQualityId>4</overallQualityId>
      <bonding>1</bonding>
      <classId>4</classId>
      <equipData>
        <inventoryType>5</inventoryType>
        <subclassName>Mail</subclassName>

      </equipData>
      <damageData/>
      <bonusStamina>25</bonusStamina>
      <bonusIntellect>23</bonusIntellect>
      <armor armorBonus="0">846</armor>
      <enchant>+6 All Stats</enchant>
      <socketData>

        <socket color="Blue" enchant="+4 Agility and +6 Stamina" icon="inv_jewelcrafting_nightseye_03" match="1"/>
        <socket color="Yellow" enchant="+8 Critical Strike Rating" icon="inv_jewelcrafting_dawnstone_03" match="1"/>
        <socket color="Blue" enchant="+4 Agility and +6 Stamina" icon="inv_jewelcrafting_nightseye_03" match="1"/>
        <socketMatchEnchant>+4 Agility</socketMatchEnchant>
      </socketData>
      <durability current="140" max="140"/>
      <requiredLevel>70</requiredLevel>
      <requiredAbility>Dragonscale Leatherworking</requiredAbility>

      <bonusCritRating>31</bonusCritRating>
      <spellData>
        <spell>
          <trigger>1</trigger>
          <desc>Increases attack power by 80.</desc>
        </spell>
        <spell>

          <trigger>1</trigger>
          <desc>Restores 8 mana per 5 sec.</desc>
        </spell>
      </spellData>
      <setData>
        <name>Netherscale Armor</name>
        <item equipped="1" name="Ebon Netherscale Belt"/>

        <item name="Ebon Netherscale Bracers"/>
        <item equipped="1" name="Ebon Netherscale Breastplate"/>
        <setBonus desc="Increases your hit rating by 20." threshold="3"/>
      </setData>
      <itemSource value="sourceType.createdBySpell"/>
    </itemTooltip>
  </itemTooltips>
</page>
#945SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3liquidf
question on the calculated DPS values. I notice that changing the bosses affects the damage done by Kill Command but not the damage done by any of the hunter's shots.

I've been wondering for a while about the actual calculated numbers - eg average steady shot damage for me is calculated as 721, while I think it hits in practice for more like 400 than 700. I figure the spreadsheet calculates paper doll dps, but if it now includes mob armor can it then determine the actual dps on the mob selected rather than a theoretical?
#946SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Trohck
While the listed damage for shots doesn't indicate what the effect of armor mitigation is, the armor mitigation is definitely applied to the shots when considering total DPS.
#947SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky

After a bit of reverse engineering all you need is the following:

http://www.wowarmory.com/item-toolti...r=Hyjal&n=Glau

Returns:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

      <enchant>+6 All Stats</enchant>
The problem is that this only gets me the text description of the enchant, not it's name (which in this case would be "Exceptional Stats". I was able to get this far, it's just doing the work of mapping the description to the name that is stymieing me right now. I can already data-mine the gems easily enough (that part should be working currently).

#949SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Version 36
Change Log:
- Fixed lookups for Leg stats
- Actually allow the user to select a different target.
- Bestial Wrath is only counted if you actually have the talent.
- More spelling corrections to match Armory names. Keep the feedback on this coming.
- Added new gear ([Shadowmaster's Boots], [Adamantite Stinger], [Infused Shadow Draenite], [Balanced Shadow Draenite], [Wicked Flame Spessarite])
- Added Curse of Recklessness to Target Debuffs.
- Fixed some errors in Ammo drop-down values mapping properly.
- Correct some items ([Vengeful Gladiator's Waraxe], [Serpent Spine Longbow], [Foreman's Reinforced Helmet])
- Reapplied checks for Meta gems.
- Meta Gems for Gladiator Gear and Engineering Helms will now appear in the correct socket locations. You may need to correct this if you load an old saved file with them. (The check to do this honestly wasn't worth the effort.)
- Fixed Resilience socket bonuses for Wrist items.
- Fixed the mix-up in hit/Crit socket bonuses for Helms.
- Added in Resilience socket bonuses for Shoulder items.
- All gear is cleared out before loading from the Armory.
- Fixed gems in Moriquendi's Helm.
- On the 'Talents' tab is a button allowing you to read your talent spec in from the Armory. Character name and Realm are settable on the 'Settings and Results' tab.
- Added support for European Servers. Select server set from the 'Settings and Results' tab.
- Validate the character and realm combination exists for the server set, a warning message is issued if you provide an invalid character.


Bugs fixed from bug-tracking post:
  • Sep 27: Calculations!D32 has a typo - Ranged WeaponWeapon DPS
  • Sep 30: Dragonstalker armor (set) - not being counted correctly.
  • Oct 09: [Serpent Spine Longbow] - listed with 16/7 stamina, not counted in stamina/HP totals.
  • Oct 18: [Gronnstalker's Helmet] - currently listed with +4 Hit Rating, should be +4 Crit Rating
  • Oct 18: Armor penetration on custom items not working correctly.
  • Oct 18: [Merciless Gladiator's Chain Helm] - set bonus not listed correctly.
  • Oct 18: [Foreman's Reinforced Helmet] - missing 30 Agility, 6 AP
  • Oct 18: [Infused Shadow Draenite] - missing.
  • Oct 18: [Balanced Shadow Draenite] - missing.
  • Oct 18: [Wicked Flame Spessarite] - missing.
  • Oct 19: [Beast Lord Helm] - incorrect socket bonus.
  • Oct 21: [Forest Prowler's Helm] - incorrect socket bonus.
  • Oct 22: [Merciless Gladiator's Chain Spaulders] - incorrect socket bonus.
  • Oct 22: [Veteran's Chain Bracers] - incorrect socket bonus.
  • Oct 23: Curse of Recklessness - missing.
  • Oct 23: [Gronnstalker's Leggings] - not counting towards set bonus.
  • Oct 23: [Shadowmaster's Boots] - missing.
  • Oct 23: Armory import sometimes inverts imported gems.
  • Oct 23: [Warden's Arrow] - display as #N/A in DPS field.
  • Oct 23: [Vengeful Gladiator's Waraxe] - stats incorrect.
  • Oct 23: [Sky-Hunter Swift Boots] - currently spelled incorrectly ("Sky Hunter Swift Boots").
  • Oct 23: [Rift Stalker Leggings] - not counting towards set bonus.
  • Oct 23: [Adamantite Stinger] - missing.
  • Oct 25: [Beast-tamer's Shoulders] - currently spelled incorrectly ("Beast tamer's Shoulders").

#954SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Jemsky

Just having a couple of problems

Same with Timeless Arrows

#958SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3_dodger_
The armory import doesn't work for me because the Armory seems to return the item names in german. I'm using an english version of Excel 2007 but running on a german Windows XP.

The solution is to open the Internet Explorer and add english as the default language.

In german: Extras -> Internetoptionen -> Allgemein -> Sprachen -> Hinzufügen. Und dann "Englisch [en]" auswählen und in der Liste ganz nach oben schieben.

In english: Tools -> Internet Options -> General -> Languages... -> Add. And then add "English [en]" and move it to the top of the list.

Now the Armory should return the results in english. I don't know if there is a better workaround for this.


And thanks again for this new version - going to check if everything was imported fine now.
#959SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by _dodger_
The armory import doesn't work for me because the Armory seems to return the item names in german. I'm using an english version of Excel 2007 but running on a german Windows XP.

The solution is to open the Internet Explorer and add english as the default language.

In german: Extras -> Internetoptionen -> Allgemein -> Sprachen -> Hinzufügen. Und dann "Englisch [en]" auswählen und in der Liste ganz nach oben schieben.

In english: Tools -> Internet Options -> General -> Languages... -> Add. And then add "English [en]" and move it to the top of the list.

Now the Armory should return the results in english. I don't know if there is a better workaround for this.


And thanks again for this new version - going to check if everything was imported fine now.
I wonder if I can build URLs such that it defaults to English. I'll play around with it and see. It would definitely make things easier.

#961SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3◊ Lactose
There's an option for selecting language on the armory pages.

GERMAN
<page globalSearch="1" lang="de_de" requestUrl="/character-sheet.xml">
<characterInfo>
<character battleGroup="Verderbnis" charUrl="r=Khaz%27goroth&amp;n=Yerr"
ENGLISH
<page globalSearch="1" lang="en_gb" requestUrl="/character-sheet.xml">
<characterInfo>
<character battleGroup="Verderbnis" charUrl="r=Khaz%27goroth&amp;n=Yerr"
EDIT: URL stays the same in both cases.
The World of Warcraft Armory

In other words:
English --> en_gb
German --> de_de
French --> fr_fr
Spanish --> es_es

#976SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3
Edited onPatch 2.2.3		Indora
will kill command be integrated into shot rotations ?
I just wanted to say the same thing. ^^

1. KC delays the autoshot.
2. KC isn't used as often as calculated, because you can't use it while you cast steady and you shouldn't use it while your autoshot is casting.

I think the best methode to calculate the time-to-use-kc is to add it to the shot rotation with the former calculated time as cooldown.

#986SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Orphis
There's a bug involving locales while fetching data from the armory. Since my computer (or maybe Excel's fault) is french, it tries to load french values from the armory, and then, nothing can really be loaded. There's a simple fix for that : 

Function getsingledata(url, searchterm)
    Set objXMLHTTP = CreateObject("MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.3.0")
    url = url & "&locale=en_us"
#987SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Orphis
There's a bug involving locales while fetching data from the armory. Since my computer (or maybe Excel's fault) is french, it tries to load french values from the armory, and then, nothing can really be loaded. There's a simple fix for that : 

Function getsingledata(url, searchterm)
    Set objXMLHTTP = CreateObject("MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.3.0")
    url = url & "&locale=en_us"
Thank you for this. I'll have it in the next version!

#990SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Enova
I would suppose resilience effects are not taken into account for dps calculations (as the spreadsheet assumes you're kept healthy and do not move/take damage/overaggro etc). Hence there's no point in adding resilience gems in the first place.
#991SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Orphis
Wrong! It is important to have all the gems because of the import from armory feature and of metagems so you don't have to fill the holes after importing with non useful gems (so you don't alter the dps calculations, let's say you would add spell damage)

#996SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Evanwill
Crit is off by .6%

I'm not sure why. I've looked over everything from talents to gems to gear. I even compared the crit rating and all of the stats of my armory profile and the spreadsheet. They all match up. Same agi, sta, etc 108 crit rating on both.

Spreadsheet says 19.56%.
Armory says 20.16%.

Here's my armory profile - The World of Warcraft Armory

Thanks for this awesome tool. I have recently switched over to playing a hunter from playing a shadow priest and I will say that min/maxing on a hunter is so much more complex, which really makes it a lot more fun for me. Your spreadsheet has really shown me some things to think about when gearing my hunter. Thanks for all you're work on this.
#997SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Evanwill
Crit is off by .6%

I'm not sure why. I've looked over everything from talents to gems to gear. I even compared the crit rating and all of the stats of my armory profile and the spreadsheet. They all match up. Same agi, sta, etc 108 crit rating on both.

Spreadsheet says 19.56%.
Armory says 20.16%.

Here's my armory profile - The World of Warcraft Armory

Thanks for this awesome tool. I have recently switched over to playing a hunter from playing a shadow priest and I will say that min/maxing on a hunter is so much more complex, which really makes it a lot more fun for me. Your spreadsheet has really shown me some things to think about when gearing my hunter. Thanks for all you're work on this.
Try adjusting target level (on the 'Settings and Results' tab) to level 70. There is a 0.6% decrease to crit for a target 15 defense higher than your weapon skill.

(By the way, does anyone know if that is still accurate? My testing is showing it may be closer to 0.1% per point of difference, but sample size is small.)
#998SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Evanwill
That was it. Thanks!

#1001SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3
Edited onPatch 2.2.3		Muarf
This might be a bug:

I load my gear from Armory, then remove your enchants and add mine (I have only a few pieces enchanted) it says: Total DPS 853.82

When I change my shoulders ([Shoulderpads of the Stranger] with [Delicate Living Ruby]) to anything then put back mine the Total DPS changes to 854.83

It seems the socket bonus (+2agi) stays when I remove it and adds again when I put it back, total agility is 681 instead of 679 after I change shoulders. If I repeat this the socket bonus doesn't add anymore, only once.

I tried to change from Stranger to shoulders with and without socket bonus (Gronnstalker / Hidden Predator) and I had the same error.

Also tried items with gems (with and without socket bonus) and without gems.

I only get this problem with shoulders, (I didn't try every slot though)

#1002SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Mystafet
Hey Cheeky,
I'm trying to get my profile to update from the Armory, yet everytime I thi the Load Gear from Armory button, I'm getting an error that says:
Run-time Error: '-2147012899 (80072ee7)':
The server name or address could not be resolved.

The World of Warcraft Armory
is my armory profile.

Please let me know what I'm doing wrong
Thanks,
-Mystafet
2 potential issues could cause this:

1 - Do you use a proxy? I don't have anything in there to support that.
2 - Do you have Firefox installed?

Other than that, I'm not sure what could be causing those errors.
#1003SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Mystafet
I'm actually on my computer at work, this might be the root cause, I will try it from my house once I get home and see how it goes.
Work Time =WoW looking up time
Home Time = WoW Playing time

Thanks for the response
#1004SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Evanwill
I had the same problem Mystafet. The spreadsheet works at home and I use Firefox at both work and home. I would assume it's an issue with a proxy as Cheeky said.
#1005SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3♦ Glaurong
It is a problem with your work internet set up.

Most times you don't have a DNS server that can resolve external addresses (turns Google into an IP address). Your browser just forwards the request on to your proxy and the proxy figures it all out.

The solution to your work day boredom lies within: You may need to run the Proxycfg tool for ServerXMLHTTP to work

#1010SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Enova
Here's a funny thought that crossed my mind, and, before you start mocking me, we ran across the topic while taking to my guildies about a hunter tanking Capernian.

Is there any way of implementing a threat estimation to the spreadsheets? Basically, since you can implement the rotation and estimate damage, it shouldn't - IN THEORY - be too difficult to assign threat values to regular hits and crits.
It's not really any use for anything other than ranged tanking (maybe just for knowing how much threat you can get when you resist a feign or two or how much an MD amounts to halfway through the fight), and I'm really not sure it's worth the effort, but a scientific (ish) approach is always welcome, if it's not out of your way too much

Oh, and this may yet be of use to people whose guilds insist on giving hunters salvation on a regular basis, too
#1011SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Originally Posted by Enova
Here's a funny thought that crossed my mind, and, before you start mocking me, we ran across the topic while taking to my guildies about a hunter tanking Capernian.

Is there any way of implementing a threat estimation to the spreadsheets? Basically, since you can implement the rotation and estimate damage, it shouldn't - IN THEORY - be too difficult to assign threat values to regular hits and crits.
It's not really any use for anything other than ranged tanking (maybe just for knowing how much threat you can get when you resist a feign or two or how much an MD amounts to halfway through the fight), and I'm really not sure it's worth the effort, but a scientific (ish) approach is always welcome, if it's not out of your way too much

Oh, and this may yet be of use to people whose guilds insist on giving hunters salvation on a regular basis, too
Your TPS is identical to your DPS, unless you wanted to start throwing Distracting Shots in as part of your rotation. With no inherent threat reduction, you should stay comfortably ahead of any ranged class with BoS on them. I know I easily top 1000-1100 TPS on a fight like Morogrim, much higher than our tanks produce. FD resists hurt, as did Hydross last night when he punished me for not being more careful after 2 in a row.

#1017SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3Cheeky
Version 37
Note: no new Open Office version as this time.

Change Log:
- Corrected more spelling mistakes for Armory compatibility.
- Added new gear (Mysterious Arrow, Mysterious Shell, Cursed Vision of Sargeras, Vengeful Gladiator's Longbow, Vengeful Gladiator's Rifle, Mystic Dawnstone, Steady Talasite, Mystic Bladestone, Steady Crysophase)
- Added Judgment of Wisdom to Target Debuffs on 'Buffs' tab.
- Support Relentless Earthstorm Diamond in first socket for helms that put Meta socket first.
- Factor miss rates into calculations in "on hit" procs for Quick Shots, Don Santos Famous Hunting Rifle, and Dragonspine Trophy. (This makes hit more valuable with those abilities/items than previously shown.)
- Corrected Aspect of the Monkey to be +8% Dodge.
- Corrected some item stats (Vengeful Gladiator's Chain Helm).
- Race is now scraped from the Armory when gear is loaded.
- Added ability set default gems for each color that will be input for any gear you select that has sockets. You can still change the gems out afterward to anything you'd like.
- Added in new food buffs (Kibler's Bits, Spicy Hot Talbuk).
#1018SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3♦ Tsook
Originally Posted by Cheeky
- Factor miss rates into calculations in "on hit" procs for Quick Shots, Don Santos Famous Hunting Rifle, and Dragonspine Trophy. (This makes hit more valuable with those abilities/items than previously shown.)
This is great! Maybe the spreedsheet will tell me 1 hit > 1 agi now.

Just a note, though, Quick Shots procs on firing, not on hit (but it doesn't take effect until the next shot -- that's why they buffed it to 12 seconds rather than the 10 seconds it used to be back in the day). I can produce a combat log proving this if you like.

EDIT: Here's the patch note from 1.10:
Improved Aspect of the Hawk - The buff from this talent has had its
duration increased from 8 seconds to 12 seconds. Note that the haste it
provides does not begin until the second shot after the triggering shot.
This change is to compensate for that delay.
#1019SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3
Edited onPatch 2.2.3		♦ Lactose
Originally Posted by Tsook
Just a note, though, Quick Shots procs on firing, not on hit
I believe the moment you fire is also the moment hit/crit/miss is calculated. A missed ranged attack will, visually, very noticably be different than a successful ranged attack (you'll miss your target completely). Since there is no apparent teleportation or crooked movement of the projectile, this indicates the trajectory (and thus the outcome of the attack) being known from moment of fire.

Updating main posts.
EDIT: Main posts updated.
Last edited by Lactose : 11/10/07 at 10:01 PM.
#1020SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3
Edited onPatch 2.2.3		♦ Tsook
Good point, Lactose. I guess the thing to do is get a low-level hunter with iAotH and go shoot Dr. Boom or something high level and see if it can proc off a shot that later misses.

EDIT: Interestingly, the text for Master Tactician specifically calls out 'your successful ranged attacks' whereas iAotH says 'all normal ranged shots.' Of course, textual differences in talent and spell descriptions has been a red herring before. I'm taking my old level 60 hunter to Dr. Boom now.
Last edited by Tsook : 11/10/07 at 10:38 PM.
#1021SourcePosted on Patch 2.2.3
Edited onPatch 2.2.3		♦ Tsook
Alright, I got insanely lucky and got a Quick Shots proc off a miss after like, a minute of messing around with my poor little level 60 hunter. Took him longer to *get to* Dr. Boom than to actually test.

Here's a snippet from the combatlog:
11/10 19:17:30.828 You gain Quick Shots.
11/10 19:17:31.359 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 176.
11/10 19:17:33.984 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 169.
11/10 19:17:35.140 Quick Shots fades from you.
11/10 19:17:36.562 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:17:37.406 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 189.
11/10 19:17:40.093 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 160.
11/10 19:17:40.546 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:17:40.546 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:17:41.671 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:17:43.078 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 167.
11/10 19:17:45.250 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:17:46.265 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 157.
11/10 19:17:46.468 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:17:46.468 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:17:49.890 You gain Quick Shots.
11/10 19:17:51.437 Your Auto Shot missed Dr. Boom.
11/10 19:17:54.187 Your Auto Shot missed Dr. Boom.
11/10 19:17:57.828 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:18:02.171 Quick Shots fades from you.
11/10 19:18:03.031 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:18:04.406 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
I highlighted the buff gain and the shot that procced it. The flight time recorded seems to vary by quite a lot, which makes me uneasy, but visually it procced and the shot went wide.

EDIT: Tested a bit more and got another Quick Shots proc off a miss (standing in a different place this time):
11/10 19:37:12.359 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 200.
11/10 19:37:12.968 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:37:12.968 Boom Bot dies.
11/10 19:37:14.500 You gain Quick Shots.
11/10 19:37:15.265 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:37:15.265 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:37:15.265 Boom Bot dies.
11/10 19:37:15.265 Boom Bot dies.
11/10 19:37:15.265 Boom Bot dies.
11/10 19:37:15.390 Your Auto Shot missed Dr. Boom.
11/10 19:37:16.593 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:37:16.609 Boom Bot is killed by Suicide.
11/10 19:37:16.609 Boom Bot dies.
11/10 19:37:16.609 Boom Bot dies.
11/10 19:37:17.390 Your Auto Shot hits Dr. Boom for 159.
As a note, Master Tactician definitely procs at hit time and should be in the list of stuff that benefits from +hit.

Wait, you took your gear and changed your talents to Survival and saw 800+ Agility and 37% crit. Then you went and raided with the BM spec in your armory and didn't see those numbers? Honey, that's not a bug, it's not realizing that a BM spec has different Agility and crit rates than a Survival build.

Your build in the Armory clearly states 41/20/0. If you use that in the spreadsheet do the numbers match up?

#1061SourcePosted on Patch 2.3.0Komatose
Couple things I noticed:

--Major Intellect Enchant to 1handers appears to add 9 stamina instead of 30 intellect
--No PvP trinkets (Intentional? Ignore this comment if so.)

--Third thing: it's possible I'm not looking in the right area, so bear with me. Background: I'm mainly focused on PvP. While trying to determine the Careful Aim vs. RWS decision (and likewise, the 2hander-agi enchant vs. 1handers-intellect enchant), I noticed there is no indication that total RAP is increased in the Gear table when CA is maxed out (3/3). I'm not sure if this is an oversight or not. I have manually added the potential RAP increase (hand adjust row). In doing so, it sways the talent-spec decision. I just don't want to be doubling up RAP if its already hidden somewhere I'm not looking.

Other than those few things, the spreadsheet is a godsend. Amazing work.
#1062SourcePosted on Patch 2.3.0
Edited onPatch 2.3.0		Juggernaught
Hey there,
Firstly, thanks for putting so much time into such an invaluable tool for all us hunters. I don't know what I'd do without it now.

I have but two questions though.
1. I was wondering if there were any plans to average out the AP gain from bloodfury like you can with trinkets?
2. Are there any plans to increment the AP gain from Hunters Mark? Currently it is treated as a flat 440AP. In reality though it starts at 110 and increases by 11 for each hit up to 440, therefore a faster weapon/shot rotation would reach the 440 AP cap quicker than a slower one, give a higher average AP over the 2 minute duration of Hunters Mark than a slower rotation would.

Once again, thanks for giving us such a great tool.

-----------EDIT----------
Actually, I do have two more questions...
3. Concussive barrage isn't currently taken into account. It's a 2%/4% chance to daze the target for 4 seconds. Steady shot does an extra 175 damage to dazed opponents. So providing your target isn't immune to daze effects, it's an extra 1-2 x 175 damage (depending on weapon speed and rotation) when it procs. Which is a minimal dps increase in reality, but an increase none the less.
4. Serpent sting is still only doing 660 damage in the spreadsheet. It now does (0.1*RAP)+660 damage, which although still means it's hugely mana inefficient for the damge it does, it may possibly be useable in a rotation now (??) as that damge is not mitegated by armor.

Although I guess they weren't really phrased as questions...
Last edited by Juggernaught : 11/20/07 at 6:29 AM.
#1063SourcePosted on Patch 2.3.0
Edited onPatch 2.3.0		Juggernaught
There's always one other thing, which is more of a musing really...

I'm wondering how the Shots per 8 seconds is calculated for Master Tactician?

I have a 3.0 speed weapon (2.609 actual speed), 4/5 imp Arcane shot, and using a 1:1.x rotation (arcane only) with a 0.2 second latency, and I'm working on the assumption that you are using Uptime = 1 - (ChanceNotToProc^Attacks)

My shots per 8 seconds in the Master Tactician section of the calculations sheet shows 7.4. However, I think this value is too high, certainly in my situation.

I have gone through my full rotation and worked out how many complete shots can be landed within an 8 second window after each shot is fired. Any incomplete shots will not effect the proc chance of Master Tactician so should be disregarded.

My rotation consists of 5 shots, so it was a fairly easy pattern to work with.
Autoshot
7 shots can be landed after this shot within 8 seconds.
Steady Shot
7 shots ...
Arcane Shot
6 shots ...
Autoshot
6 shots ...
Steady Shot
8 shots ...
and the pattern repeats.

This gives me an average of 6.8 shots per 8 seconds. Then you have to factor in my miss rate of 0.73% giving 6.8*0.9927, giving me an average "Shots per 8 seconds" of 6.75.

Unless I'm missing something obvious?
Last edited by Juggernaught : 11/20/07 at 12:00 PM.
#1064SourcePosted on Patch 2.3.0Midnight
In an efford to make up for my unnesseccary question above I´ll try to answer a few questions whose answers seem obvious to me. Feel free to correct me if I´m wrong of course.
Originally Posted by Komatose
--No PvP trinkets (Intentional? Ignore this comment if so.)
PvP trinkets won´t influence any calculations performed by the spreadsheet, so it propably doesn´t really make a lot of sense to include it. If you want to check your DPS with a pvp trinket on, just leave the row blank.
Originally Posted by Komatose
--Third thing: it's possible I'm not looking in the right area, so bear with me. Background: I'm mainly focused on PvP. While trying to determine the Careful Aim vs. RWS decision (and likewise, the 2hander-agi enchant vs. 1handers-intellect enchant), I noticed there is no indication that total RAP is increased in the Gear table when CA is maxed out (3/3). I'm not sure if this is an oversight or not. I have manually added the potential RAP increase (hand adjust row). In doing so, it sways the talent-spec decision. I just don't want to be doubling up RAP if its already hidden somewhere I'm not looking.
RAP is calculated even though it doesn´t show on the gear sheet. Check the RAP section of the calculations sheet. It does take into account Careful Aim too.
Originally Posted by Juggernaught
3. Concussive barrage isn't currently taken into account. It's a 2%/4% chance to daze the target for 4 seconds. Steady shot does an extra 175 damage to dazed opponents. So providing your target isn't immune to daze effects, it's an extra 1-2 x 175 damage (depending on weapon speed and rotation) when it procs. Which is a minimal dps increase in reality, but an increase none the less.
I assume this is intentional as the spreadsheet aims at calculating your dps agains bosses and bosses usually can´t be dazed.
Originally Posted by Juggernaught
4. Serpent sting is still only doing 660 damage in the spreadsheet. It now does (0.1*RAP)+660 damage, which although still means it's hugely mana inefficient for the damge it does, it may possibly be useable in a rotation now (??) as that damge is not mitegated by armor.(...)
It seems like all other shots still scale way better. That means that depending on your enemies armor at some point there´s a break even where the other shots will do more damage. From my personal observation I´d say this break even is somewhere around T4ish quality gear.
Nevertheless I agree serpent sting should be modelled correctly as soon as Cheeky finds some time to integrate it into his spreadsheet.
#1065SourcePosted on Patch 2.3.0
